column4: Okay, I'm missing something.  Everything I try to install says that it has dependencies and cannot install them.  Are there repository changes that need to be changed usually?
try sudo apt-get update, then sudo apt-get -f install and then it may work
So, everyone uses apt instead of the Symbian thing?
Synaptic is just a frontend for apt-get
Cool.  Thanx.
np

Does everything have to be forced during their install?  If so, then why?  For example, I'm trying to install Eclipse and I'm getting errors like, "eclipse-platform: Depends: eclipse-rcp (= 3.1.1-1ubuntu3) but it is not going to be installed
shouldnt happen much, are you running breezy?
Yup, just got the CDs in the mail.
There are also dependencies for Qt 3 that are needed but aren't in the "universe" or CD repositories.
i just tried to install ecplise-platform, had no dependency problems - i can send you my sources.list if you like
Sure, that would be great.  But, did you add any sources that aren't default?
a few i think, like openoffice2 final and wine
Those shouldn't affect Eclipse or Qt, though.
Did you add universe and multiverse??
multiverse?
not sure if that would do it, but its always the first thing i do on ubuntu
Open synaptic and go to repositories
I'm there... just the CD and "Universe."
if you click add and add the repositories (with universe and multiverse ticked) then do an apt-get update see if it helps
Hmm... interesting.  Although the comments list the "Universe" entry as "Community maintained," that is the ONLY checkbox that is not selected for it.  Is that correct?
Not really sure i have them all ticked.
also you can always remove/change them later
Well, it appears to have worked.  Thanx!  =)
